StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [UpdatePersonData]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
@PersonID int = 0, @SocialSecurityNumber varchar(9) = null, @FirstName varchar(20) = null, @LegalMiddleName varchar(20) = null, @LastName varchar(20) = null, @Su.xCD varchar(5) = null, @UserLogin varchar(15), @ID int = @PersonID OUTPUT AS
IF EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM PERSON WHERE PERSON_ID = @PersonID) BEGIN UPDATE PERSON SET SOCIAL_SECURITY_NUMBER = @SocialSecurityNumber, FIRST_NAME = @FirstName, LEGAL_MIDDLE_NAME = @LegalMiddleName, LAST_NAME = @LastName, SUFFIX_CD = @Su.xCD, USER_LOGIN = @UserLogin, UPDATE_DATE = GetDate() WHERE PERSON_ID = @PersonID
SET @ID = @PersonID
END ELSE BEGIN IF EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM PERSON WHERE SOCIAL_SECURITY_NUMBER = @SocialSecurityNumber) BEGIN
UPDATE PERSON SET FIRST_NAME = @FirstName, LEGAL_MIDDLE_NAME = @LegalMiddleName, LAST_NAME = @LastName, SUFFIX_CD = @Su.xCD, USER_LOGIN = @UserLogin, UPDATE_DATE = GetDate() WHERE SOCIAL_SECURITY_NUMBER = @SocialSecurityNumber
SELECT @ID = PERSON_ID FROM PERSON WHERE SOCIAL_SECURITY_NUMBER = @SocialSecurityNumber
END ELSE BEGIN INSERT INTO PERSON (SOCIAL_SECURITY_NUMBER, FIRST_NAME, LEGAL_MIDDLE_NAME, LAST_NAME, SUFFIX_CD, USER_LOGIN, UPDATE_DATE) VALUES (@SocialSecurityNumber, @FirstName, @LegalMiddleName, @LastName, @Su.xCD, @UserLogin, GETDATE())
SET @ID = @@IDENTITY
END END
